Lunarpine awoke in his chamber, the virus scan showed no sign of the 
virus in any form. His chamber opened again and he stepped out. 
Veratis greeted him with a look of relief. The monitor showed the owl 
DNA merging with the polar bear DNA. 

"What will become of her?" Lunarpine asked, his concern shined 
through his beedy eyes. "Will she be alright?" he stepped closer to 
the scientist for a better view.

"I'm hoping that the owl DNA would turn her back into her fusor form. 
Unfortunately it seems to have the reverse effect. Instead ofmerging 
the two DNA strands are some how intertwining with each other." The 
scientist in him was fascinated by the prospect. The creator in him 
began to worry. "The virus has stopped growing. All I can suggest is 
we watch her closely and hope her new form can fight it off."

 that--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> Ice::
> 
> She was roared again in the chamber just as the seditive was taking 
> effect. She fell into a deep sleep. 
> 
> Her mind stilll focused on the cage. She had always been free. Free 
> to move where the wind took her. Now with her new body, she could 
> have been free to roam the iced lands and wander where the land 
took 
> her. But instead, this virus trapped her. She was a threat to 
herself 
> and all those around her. She could see the cage of metal bars 
> surounding her and keeping her shut in.  She was no longer free, 
but 
> a prisoner. And one the might have to be destroyed. She roared out 
in 
> her sleep as the thought of them having to kill her ran through her 
> thoughts. Despite the seditive, she was in a fitful sleep. 
> 
>
